content: Maize Grass is a plant fairly similar in structure to Common Grass,
but it grows much taller and produces edible seeds.
It is more easily grown in more arid regions rather than those with wetter climes.
The maize grass plant is fairly tall, easily growing up to the height of an adult male human.
At the very tip is a tassel of small flower structures.
Like all grasses, the maize grass plant also grows leaves along the stem in an alternating fashion.
Near the middle of the plant, the leaves sheathe a husk containing the plant's seeds.
Inside of the husk is a cylindrical fiberous core that the pale yellow seeds are attached to.
At the end of the seed husk is a bunch of fiberous "silk"-like material.
This "silk" changes colour based on how mature the plant is, going from pale green to a shade of purple.
